lead_paragraph: Whether Prime Minister Abe will be able to pursue his ambition of overturning the clause that calls for the complete renunciation of war remains to be seen.

byline.contributor: Makiko Inoue and Hisako Ueno contributed reporting.

headline.print_headline: Japan Vote Strengthens  Prime Minister’s Effort  to Change Constitution
headline.main: Japan Vote Strengthens Shinzo Abe’s Goal to Change Constitution

snippet: Whether Prime Minister Abe will be able to pursue his ambition of overturning the clause that calls for the complete renunciation of war remains to be seen....
abstract: Governing coalition of Prime Min Shinzo Abe gains two-thirds of seats in Japan's upper house of Parliament, move which enables them to revise 69-year-old Constitution that denounces war.
